bboxes.raw_text:
ROOSEVELT SCHOOL DISTRICT
NEWS


Registration for all classes
will be Fri, Sept. A, and classes
will open Tues. Sept. 8 at
scheduled time.


JULIAN Sept. 4 registration
o-l2; l-3. The bus will run
schedule at $3.50 am: 9 am.
and l pm.


Grades 3-8 will be held at
Julian this year. Grades 80
2:3O; Grades 40 1920: and
Grades 7-8 8:2O-3:20 pm.


Two new teachers have been
added Mrs. Ella Pearl Phil
lips. graduate of Prairie View
College grade S; and Alvin
Lyles. graduate Arizona State
College at Flagstaff. band.


PALMDALE One new tea
cher added Miss Ethel Daniels,
grade 8. Mrs. Irma Coleman
returning and Mrs. Sandra Mo-
men, nurse.


SHERATON PARK PRIMARY -
Registration Sept. 4 = 8:30-3:30.
New faculty members include
Mrs. Karen Baillon, librarian;
Mesdames Gloria Jones, Ann
Holland, and Irma Saunders.


Mrs. Betty Wills on is the nurse.

FORT WORTH. Tex. NAACP
representatives asked the school
board to adopt policy of full
integration for the public schools.


DR.. George D. Flemmings,
president Of the NAACP Fort
Woth branch. requested that the
NAACP recommendations be
adopted.


The request said that Negroes
should attend schools near where
they live. The NAACP also called
for the opening of the Techni-
cal High School to all students
on the same basis.


DR.. Flemmings reminded the
Board that they have "a court
directive that dates back l0years
and a national policy declared in
the recent Civil Rights Acts to
support your decision


First President to ride to his
inauguration ceremonies in an
automobile Theodore Roo
sevelt.

SPARTANSBURG. sc. -Adri-
enne Douglas. daughter Of a Negro
doctor, was the only one of her
race to enter a white school. She
is in the eleventh grade.
Negro Pupils Enter Schools in Dixie

AUGUSTA, Ga. = Four Negro
pupils registered at previously
all white schools here without
any trouble.

Chapel AME Church the marriage
Miss Jean Allen and Altman George E. Dove.


The performed Sat- Aug %. Rev. L. Williams
oficiaed.


The bride the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Allen 1914
She High Chicago
The groom the of Rev. and Mrs. L. Dove of Prescott
Arkansas. He is stationed at Luke Air Force Base.

full articles.headline:
FULL SCHOOL
INTERROGATION SOUGHT
full articles.article:
FORT WORTH. Tex. NAACP
representatives asked the school
board to adopt policy of full
integration for the public schools.


DR.. George D. Flemmings,
president Of the NAACP Fort
Woth branch. requested that the
NAACP recommendations be
adopted.


The request said that Negroes
should attend schools near where
they live. The NAACP also called
for the opening of the Techni-
cal High School to all students
on the same basis.


DR.. Flemmings reminded the
Board that they have "a court
directive that dates back l0years
and a national policy declared in
the recent Civil Rights Acts to
support your decision


First President to ride to his
inauguration ceremonies in an
automobile Theodore Roo
sevelt.
